column4: i was going to install 8.04 and during the partition process i got confused and instead of splitting my hard drive into two partions i made it into one 20gig partition so now windows wont boot, i download testdisk so i just write testdisk MBR code to first sector?
? would that fix the problem?
or do i need to completely repair the NTFS master file table?
? any help?
does anyone know what i should do about my partition?
anyone familiar with testdisk?
im really not sure, when i run the ubuntu live cd it just shows a 20 gig drive, which its actually 40, but i boot into windows
*i cant boot into windows
run   gparted     to see whats going on with your partitions
yep
wait -- its meant to be a windows drive yeah?
the drive in question -- is it meant to be windows or ubuntu?
well -- not anymore im afraid --
the files from the windows drive? unlikely, sound like its been reformatted -- u could mount it and see whats on it
what is the path /dev/sda2?
do      sudo mount /dev/sda1 /mnt/drive && cd /mnt/drive
you missed a space      /dev/sda1'space'/mnt/drive
do this first then        sudo mkdir /mnt/drive
ok, now do       cd /mnt/drive && ls -lah
it was supposed to give u a list of everything on your hard drive
can u pastebin the 3 lines of stuff please
yeah, theres nothing on that drive im afraid
all them files you had are gone im afraid -- no way of recovering afaik
glad i could help -- sorry bout your  files
